system.description:
Three bodies bearing strange xenos markings have been discovered in the Gallowsway District. Local Sanctionaries are overwhelmed—this demands Inquisitorial attention.

  • Proceed to the crime scene in Gallowsway and examine the bodies.
  • Make contact with Oath-Captain Nils of the Sanctionaries for local intelligence.
  • Determine the nature and origin of the xenos markings on the victims.

name: Track the Smugglers Through the Underhive

system.description:
The xenos artefacts are moving through Desoleum's underhive via established smuggling networks. The trail must be followed to its source.

  • Follow the artefact trail into the underhive.
  • Navigate territory controlled by Vornas Crimson and the Red Walk gang.
  • Trace the smuggling network to identify the source of the artefacts.

The trail leads beyond the hive walls into the hostile wasteland surrounding Desoleum. The Trade Sable operates a smuggler camp in the deep desert.

  • Traverse the Desoleum Wastes—a hostile and unforgiving environment.
  • Survive encounters with Gwydrae nomads, waste predators, and the desert itself.
  • Locate and infiltrate the Trade Sable smuggler camp.

Evidence points to the shrine world of Thaur as the ultimate destination of the smuggling conspiracy. Passage must be secured aboard a vessel bound for that world.

  • Secure passage aboard the Oath Unspoken, a Rogue Trader vessel commanded by Lord-Captain Aristide Anzaforr.
  • The ship carries thousands of pilgrims to Thaur—blend in or negotiate openly.
  • Investigate evidence that the conspiracy extends aboard the vessel itself.

name: Uncover the Cult Aboard the Oath Unspoken

system.description:
A cult calling itself the Children of the Inheritance has embedded agents among the pilgrims. Their purpose aboard the Oath Unspoken must be exposed before landfall.

  • Identify cultist operatives among the pilgrim population.
  • Look for signs: bone-chip tokens, whispered prayers to the Remembered God, secret rituals in the corpse-holds.
  • Locate their leader, Praesul Parathas Hayne, and determine the cult's plan.

The Children of the Inheritance have launched their assault. The ship is under attack from within.

  • Defend the Oath Unspoken alongside the Anzaforr Armsmen.
  • Rally allies among crew and pilgrims to repel the cultist assault.
  • Secure critical decks and prevent the cultists from seizing control of the vessel.

Jeronius Pyre, Lord of the Wake and ruler of Thaur, has detained the warband. Outsiders are unwelcome during the sacred Festival of Bones.

  • Negotiate your release through diplomacy or Inquisitorial authority.
  • Intimidate the Lord Governor into compliance.
  • If all else fails—escape captivity by any means necessary.

The path to the enemy leads deep beneath Thaur's surface, through ossuaries that give way to something far older and far worse than Imperial crypts.

  • Descend through the Great Ossuaria into the alien tunnels below.
  • Navigate shifting architecture—from Imperial Gothic crypts to disturbing organic passages.
  • Find the path to the Chamber of Izumat before the Children of the Inheritance complete their ritual.

Carolus Renthear leads the Children of the Inheritance in a blasphemous rite to resurrect a Daemon Prince using the accumulated xenos artefacts. The ritual must not succeed.

  • Disrupt the ritual circle before it reaches completion.
  • Destroy the xenos artefacts fuelling the summoning.
  • Eliminate Renthear before the entity known as Izumat can be restored to the material world.

The ritual has succeeded. The Daemon Prince Suvfaeras manifests in the Chamber of Izumat—an ancient Warp entity of devastating power.

  • Destroy the remaining xenos artefacts to weaken the daemon's anchor to reality.
  • Coordinate attacks with surviving allies.
  • Banish Suvfaeras back to the Immaterium before it can escape the catacombs and unleash itself upon Thaur.

A shard of smooth, black material that seems to absorb light. Its surface is warm to the touch and covered in geometric patterns that shift when viewed from different angles. Prolonged contact causes disturbing whispers at the edge of hearing. These fragments are pieces of a larger whole, connected to the ancient entity known as Izumat.

Special: Carrying a fragment imposes a -10 penalty on Willpower tests to resist Fear and Corruption. A character holding a fragment when Suvfaeras manifests must pass a Challenging (+0) Willpower test or be Stunned for 1 round.

The signature weapon of the Ossuarian Custodians of Thaur. This heavy polearm features a broad blade with an integrated promethium reservoir that coats the cutting edge in sacred fire. The Custodians use these weapons to guard the Great Ossuaria from tomb robbers and heretics.

Righteous Blaze: Once per encounter, after normal damage is inflicted, the weapon can deal an additional 1d10+5 Energy damage that ignores armour. The weapon then loses the Flame quality until repaired (1 day).

One of the most powerful talismans of office on Thaur, carried by the Lord of the Wake. This ornate censer is fashioned from bone and precious metals, perpetually wreathed in fragrant incense smoke. It serves as both a symbol of authority and a powerful protective device.

Special: Grants a +20 bonus to Social skill tests directed at loyal Thaur natives. Contains a hidden force field generator that functions as a Best quality conversion field (50% chance to negate a hit, overloads on 01-10 and ceases to function for 1d5 rounds).

A brittle scroll inscribed with blasphemous text in a mixture of High Gothic and an unknown xenos script. It details the ritual required to awaken the Daemon Prince Suvfaeras from its imprisonment beneath Thaur. Reading the scroll requires a Challenging (+0) Forbidden Lore (Daemonology) test and inflicts 1d5 Corruption points.

Special: If destroyed during the ritual, the ritual's progress is reduced by one stage. Renthear carries a copy but the original is kept at the ritual site.

A viscous, iridescent liquid contained in a sealed crystal phial. This substance is of xenos origin, recovered from deep within Thaur's catacombs. It pulses with a faint inner light and is warm to the touch. The Children of the Inheritance use it as a sacramental substance in their rituals.

Special: Contact with exposed skin inflicts 1d10 Energy damage (ignoring armour) and 1d5 Corruption points. If poured on a xenos artefact fragment, the fragment activates and begins emitting a low hum audible to psykers within 100 metres. The Blood is a key component of the resurrection ritual.
